channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: URGENT Utility access cover hatch trip hazard, 24th July
item.description:
A Utility access cover hatch has been left open, posing a very serious trip hazard and needs to be seen to immediately please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southcott Mews, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Dangerous junction, 24th July
item.description:
Long lorry required to use forward and reverse gears to turn left out of College Road into Crystal Palace Parade. Driver could not make the sweep left turn due to location of traffic islands and road markings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holes and ridges are appearing in the public pavement, 24th July
item.description:
People and residents are now tripping and stumbling over these hazard which have been appearing over the past year. Please ensure that any repairs are carried out asap, and with the existing brick paviours (and not asphal). it is important that the character of this public waterside amenity is preserved, as per the original planning application materials approval. thank you for your help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Quay, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
